questionText: Bouchard pledged to hold another referendum if his party won the next election in 1998.
author: A24DSECWUBZC0Z

questionText: As the November election approached polls indicated that Bouchard had a wide lead over the Liberal (Federalist) candidate.
author: A24DSECWUBZC0Z

questionText: The issue was presented to the Supreme Court which ruled in August 1998 that Quebec could not separate unilaterally
author: A24DSECWUBZC0Z

questionText: The Quebec Premier Parizeau resigned after defeat in the referendum

questionText: Lucien Bouchard stepped forward to assume the Premiership and leadership of the Party Quebecois

questionText: Canadian Prime Minister Chretien stated that Quebec could not unilaterally secede without amendment of the Canadian Constitution.

questionText: After the November 1998 elections polls showed only 41% favoring independence.

questionText: Prime Minister Chretien's definition of what was required for independence antagonized Quebeckers.
